|---Scryed---|

[--------------------------------------]
Date: Sometime during the first BW. 
Location: Out of Maximal and 
Predacon scanner range, 50 degrees 
northern longitude.
{--------------------------------------}

Anyone looking at the sky above that night would have seen bright 
white lines streaking across the sky. However, on that particular 
night, one of the meteors seemed to collide with another and change 
is direction slightly.

Whether the ambiguity was dismissed by any who witnessed it, or 
whether it wasn't spotted at all is not known. Regardless, the 
result was a damaged pod that had the unfortunate chance to enter 
the atmosphere at the same time as the Earth's planetary path passed 
by the edge of the Lyanids asteroid field.

The pod screamed downward, it's entry velocity only aided by the 
atmospheric collision. Fortunatly for the bot inside, the pod mostly 
survived the crash. Sever damages were suffered to it's outer 
armour, but it managed to make it through. The lack of internal 
damage was likely accounted for by the fact that the meteor 
partially broke off and stuck to the pod.

The silences of the mountains was shattered as the pod smashed into 
side of a low mountain, partially digging itself under some 
sedimentary soil. The scanner popped out on impact, and scanned a 
medium sized Black Bear, but the pod itself was too damaged to do 
anything but sit and wait for repairs.

And so, the pod remained stuck and time passed causing terrain 
changes. Erosion and weathering caused sediment to layer itself on 
the pod, and soon it was relatively buried. As more time passed, the 
small mountains pushed their way up several inches eacher year, and 
a few more layers blanketed the location of the pod. The pod 
appeared to be lost-- but, the pod was equiped with a minor internal 
repair system which activated itself not long after the pod imbedded 
itself into the mountain side. Damaged by both crashes, but still 
there, the repair systems began their work, slowly but steadily.

A time would come when the pod would reawaken.

[--------------------------------------]
Date: Current day. 
Location: Several hundered kilometres
north-north-west of the Maximal base.
{--------------------------------------}

The pod's beacon systems awaken, and a Maximal frequency signal is 
released. The signal was weak but was undoubtably a Maximal signal. 
The pod itself, hidden under many layers of sediment and rocky 
debri, remains there repaired and ready to be released.
